content:
```
Define the module TopModule with input ports: clock, a and output ports: p, q.

Retrieved Related Information:
- clock: Clock signal, used to trigger flip-flops and latches (Type:Signal)
- a: Input signal (Type:Signal)
- p: Output signal, controlled by flip-flops (Type:Signal)
- q: Output signal, controlled by latches (Type:Signal)
- At 85ns, on the rising edge of clock, if a is 0, p remains 0 and q remains 0. (Type:StateTransition)
- At 90ns, on the rising edge of clock, if a is 1, p becomes 1 and q remains 0. (Type:StateTransition)
- At 115ns, on the falling edge of clock, p remains 1 and q becomes 1. (Type:StateTransition)
- At 145ns, on the rising edge of clock, if a is 0, p becomes 0 and q remains 1. (Type:StateTransition)
- At 165ns, on the rising edge of clock, if a is 1, p becomes 1 and q remains 1. (Type:StateTransition)
- At 90ns, clock is 1, a is 1, p transitions to 1, q remains 0. (Type:SignalExample)
- At 165ns, clock is 1, a is 1, p transitions to 1, q remains 1. (Type:SignalExample)
```
source:
I would like you to implement a module named TopModule with the following interface. All input and output ports are one bit unless otherwise specified.

 - input  clock
 - input  a
 - output p
 - output q

content:
```
Implement the latch for signal p, which is active when the clock is high. The latch should store the value of input a.

Retrieved Related Information:
At 90ns, on the rising edge of clock, if a is 1, p becomes 1. (Type:StateTransition)
At 145ns, on the rising edge of clock, if a is 0, p becomes 0. (Type:StateTransition)
At 165ns, on the rising edge of clock, if a is 1, p becomes 1. (Type:StateTransition)
At 90ns, clock is 1, a is 1, p transitions to 1. (Type:SignalExample)
At 165ns, clock is 1, a is 1, p transitions to 1. (Type:SignalExample)
```
source:
The module should implement a circuit with flip-flops and latches. Flip-flops are triggered by clock edge. Latches are triggered during active high period of clock.

[Info]p is a active high (clock is 1) latch.

content:
```
Implement the flip-flop for signal q, which is triggered on the negative edge of the clock. The flip-flop should store the value of signal p.

Retrieved Related Information:
At 115ns, on the falling edge of clock, p remains 1 and q becomes 1. (Type:StateTransition)
At 90ns, clock is 1, a is 1, p transitions to 1, q remains 0. (Type:SignalExample)
At 165ns, clock is 1, a is 1, p transitions to 1, q remains 1. (Type:SignalExample)
```
source:
The module should implement a circuit with flip-flops and latches. Flip-flops are triggered by clock edge. Latches are triggered during active high period of clock.

[Info]q is a negedge triggered flip-flop.
